cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles WSW of the Dry Tortugas, or 125 miles N of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift slowly north on Tuesday, then turn northeast late week and cross the Florida peninsula before reaching the Georgia–South Carolina coast by Saturday, then moving offshore into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf coast of Florida (Big Bend/Tampa–Cedar Key zone)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect at this time.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect at this time.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and peninsula, Florida Big Bend, coastal Georgia and South Carolina including Port of Charleston
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 4+ inches with the slow-moving storm)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions; low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds. Gusts mainly 25-35 mph late Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible around the time the center passes Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday night through Saturday could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands Friday–Saturday; rough seas and rip currents ahead of and during passage.
